stories.text:
Hey everyone, WebReducer is a project I've been working on since last December. You can read about my process here: https://offbyone.us/tags/micro-business/

Send some data to WebReducer. Then, write a reducer function to retain some state. You can change the reducer function as much as you want and recreate that state.

Still working on how to explain it. It's a tiny FaaS platform. It's a tiny database. It's micro event sourcing. It's "redux" on the server as a service. It's a backend for tiny personal projects. It's a place to send your webhooks.

I'm looking for feedback on the following:

- Do you get what it is?

- What would you use it for?

- What would I need to iron out for you to seriously consider trying this?
stories.title: Show HN: WebReducer – micro event sourcing cloud function
Is There A “Great Resignation”? Basically its just boomers retiring
Rogue HackerOne employee steals bug reports to sell on the side
Google now deleting health clinic searches from location history automatically

stories.text:
In the spirit of the monthly "Who's hiring?" and related threads, this thread is for people looking to work together on cool projects, whether they be side projects, research, art, starting a startup, etc.

If you're looking to team up, for fun or profit, please post your project and/or skills here!

(Inspired by: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=29759115)
stories.title: Ask HN: Who wants to collaborate? (July 2022)
